thread.title: Navy nabs 27 suspected drug peddlers during safe haven operation in Lagos
thread.title_full: Navy nabs 27 suspected drug peddlers during safe haven operation in Lagos

author: Admin I
title: Navy nabs 27 suspected drug peddlers during safe haven operation in Lagos
text:
Operatives of the Nigeria Navy Ship (NNS) Beecroft have nabbed 27 suspected drug peddlers during a raid of a criminal hideout in Lagos.
The suspects were arrested following a coordinated raid that dislodged identified criminal safe haven in Gidan Drama, located at Malu Road, Apapa area of the state.
Speaking at the event, the Commander, NNS, Beecroft, Commodore Paul Ponfa Nimmyel, at a briefing at NNS Beecroft headquarters, Apapa, stated that the raid was carried out on Saturday by personnel of NNS Beecroft, following credible intelligence received by the base on the presence of suspected drug peddlers in Gidan Drama which necessitated the deployment of Operation MESA.
The Commander who was ably represented by the Executive Officer (EO), Captain Idongesit Udoessien, stated that during the raid, a total of 27 suspected drug peddlers , comprising 3 females and 24 males were arrested with hard drugs and other illicit substances.
â€œThe female suspects were named as follows: Ajike Rahime,20; Padipe Olamiposin, 20; Ayike Yusuf 2. While males counterpart were also identified as Samaili Ibrahim, 21; Yusuf Danjuma, 30, the females suspects were named as follows: Ajike Rahime,20; Padipe Olamiposin, 20; Ayike Yusuf 2. While males counterpart were also identified as Samaili Ibrahim, 21; Yusuf Danjuma, 30, Hamisu Sanusi, 34, Odi Yahaya, 20, Adamu Umaru, 23, Friday Ochoba, 45, Michael Istwuo, 25, Eze Frank, 40, Joshua Esua,20, Daus John, 19, Musa Andrawus, 34, Nwakaeze David, 21, Abubakar Shamsu, 24, Elisha Mark, 18.
